content.question: If the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></math> applied to a gas is increased while the gas is held at a constant temperature, then the volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></math> of the gas will decrease. The rate of change of the volume of gas with respect to the pressure is proportional to the reciprocal of the square of the pressure. Which of the following is a differential equation that could describe this relationship?

choices.label: <math alttext="V equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator P squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math> is a positive constant.

<math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to P, equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator P squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math> is a positive constant.

<math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to P, equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator P squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math> is a negative constant.

<math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to V, equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator P squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math> is a negative constant.

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of V, with respect to P, equals, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator P squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math> is a negative constant.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
